subject: p10523725
History: Fever, chills and sweats, cough, and blood-tinged sputum.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. The patient is after median sternotomy and CABG. Heart size is mildly enlarged. Aorta is tortuous. No definitive evidence of aneurysm is demonstrated. Lateral view demonstrates stent placement within the bypass arteries. There is no pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
